snippet: The number of armed bank robberies in the city rose in 2011, and the closing rate for the cases fell.
abstract: The number of armed bank robberies in the city rose in 2011, and the closing rate for the cases fell.

byline.original: By JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and AL BAKER

lead_paragraph: A year ago, the New York Police Department pulled its six detectives from the Joint Bank Robbery Task Force, the combined F.B.I./Police Department unit that for more than 30 years had handled armed bank robberies in the city.

headline.main: One Thing Hasn't Changed: Banks Have the Money
